history.content:
I've been able to run Ubuntu using Virtual Box for ROS & OpenCV development. I'm not sure what your needs are but for a MacBook Pro with 8GB of RAM, I was able to run things fairly smoothly. Granted the image processing was done on a different computer (the robot), I only used my mac for development. In terms of resources, I dedicated one core to the VM and about 1-2GB of RAM depending on my needs at the time. I think 4+ GB of RAM could be dedicated as long as I closed most of the apps on macOS.

There are various optimizations you can do to help things run better, depending on where your bottleneck is. For me, I disabled most of the graphics enhancements that Ubuntu offered and was programming mostly in vim on Ubuntu. (I was also just too lazy to reinstall the heavier IDEs). It's fairly easy to file transfer between the host macOS and Ubuntu so I was able to use the IDEs on macOS if desired.

children.subject: I was able to run Ubuntu without trouble on my 2015 macbook pro, but it seems running it directly on the post 2016 MBPs is still very problematic. You might consider looking into Amazon Web Services. If you are comfortable developing over command line you can rent and remotely access an Ubuntu server. Can get a bit pricey though.
